leaf_cluster_name: 气候-数值模式与数据同化生态
task_chain: 模式→同化→评估→后处理→复现
tool_form: 模式组件 + 同化库 + 评测

tools.name: ACCESS-OM2
tools.one_line_profile: Global coupled ocean-sea ice model configuration and code
tools.detailed_description: ACCESS-OM2 is a global coupled ocean-sea ice model that combines the MOM5.1 ocean model and the CICE5.1.2 sea ice model, coupled via OASIS3-MCT. It is designed for climate research and simulation.

tools.name: LBLRTM
tools.one_line_profile: Line-By-Line Radiative Transfer Model
tools.detailed_description: LBLRTM is an accurate and efficient line-by-line radiative transfer model derived from the FASCODE algorithm. It is used for calculating spectral radiance and transmittance in the atmosphere.

tools.name: monoRTM
tools.one_line_profile: Monochromatic Radiative Transfer Model
tools.detailed_description: monoRTM is a radiative transfer model designed to process a small number of monochromatic frequencies, suitable for microwave regions and laser applications, utilizing the same physics as LBLRTM.

tools.name: CRITERIA-3D
tools.one_line_profile: Three-dimensional agro-hydrological model
tools.detailed_description: CRITERIA-3D is a three-dimensional agro-hydrological model for small catchments, simulating water balance, nitrogen flow, and heat transport in soil and vegetation systems.

tools.name: F0AM
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for 0-D Atmospheric Modeling
tools.detailed_description: F0AM is a MATLAB-based framework for zero-dimensional atmospheric chemistry box modeling, designed to simulate chemical kinetics and photolysis in the atmosphere.

tools.name: AtChem2
tools.one_line_profile: Atmospheric chemistry box-model for the MCM
tools.detailed_description: AtChem2 is a Fortran-based atmospheric chemistry box model that uses the Master Chemical Mechanism (MCM) to simulate complex chemical processes in the atmosphere.

tools.name: DLESyM
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Learning Earth System Model software
tools.detailed_description: DLESyM is a software package for training, running, and analyzing Deep Learning Earth System Models, facilitating the integration of AI into climate modeling.

tools.name: SeaFreeze
tools.one_line_profile: Thermodynamic and elastic properties of water and ice
tools.detailed_description: SeaFreeze is a package for computing the thermodynamic and elastic properties of water and various ice polymorphs (Ih, III, V, VI) over a wide range of pressures and temperatures.

tools.name: C-Coupler2
tools.one_line_profile: Community coupler for model coupling and nesting
tools.detailed_description: C-Coupler2 is a flexible and user-friendly community coupler designed for coupling and nesting various earth system model components.

tools.name: CABLE
tools.one_line_profile: Community Atmosphere Biosphere Land Exchange model
tools.detailed_description: CABLE is a land surface model used to simulate the exchange of momentum, energy, water, and carbon between the land surface and the atmosphere.

tools.name: paleoToolkit
tools.one_line_profile: Paleoclimate tools for CESM
tools.detailed_description: paleoToolkit provides a set of tools and utilities for configuring and running the Community Earth System Model (CESM) for paleoclimate simulations.

tools.name: OceanMesh2D
tools.one_line_profile: Two-dimensional triangular mesh generator for ocean models
tools.detailed_description: OceanMesh2D is a MATLAB-based mesh generation tool designed to build unstructured triangular meshes for coastal ocean circulation models like ADCIRC, FVCOM, and SCHISM.

tools.name: CICE
tools.one_line_profile: Community Sea Ice Model
tools.detailed_description: CICE is a computationally efficient sea ice model that simulates the growth, melt, and movement of sea ice, widely used in global climate and earth system models.

tools.name: ACCESS-OM2 (COSIMA)
tools.one_line_profile: Source code for ACCESS-OM2 ocean-sea ice model
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains the source code and configurations for the ACCESS-OM2 global ocean-sea ice coupled model, maintained by the COSIMA community.

tools.name: ACCESS-OM3
tools.one_line_profile: Source code for ACCESS-OM3 ocean-sea ice-wave model
tools.detailed_description: ACCESS-OM3 is the next-generation global coupled model including ocean (MOM6), sea ice (CICE6), and waves (WW3), developed by the COSIMA community.

tools.name: cice5-access
tools.one_line_profile: ACCESS configuration of CICE5 sea ice model
tools.detailed_description: This is a clone of the Los Alamos CICE sea ice model (version 5.1.2) adapted with drivers for the ACCESS climate model framework.

tools.name: cosima-cookbook
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for analyzing ocean-sea ice model output
tools.detailed_description: The COSIMA Cookbook is a Python framework for indexing, querying, and analyzing output data from ocean and sea ice models, specifically designed for the ACCESS-OM2 suite.

tools.name: regional-mom6
tools.one_line_profile: Regional MOM6 configuration generator
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for automatically generating regional configurations for the Modular Ocean Model 6 (MOM6), simplifying the setup of regional ocean simulations.

tools.name: CrocoDash
tools.one_line_profile: Regional MOM6 setup package for CESM
tools.detailed_description: CrocoDash is a software package designed to facilitate the setup and configuration of regional MOM6 ocean models within the Community Earth System Model (CESM) framework.

tools.name: RavenHydroFramework
tools.one_line_profile: Raven Hydrological Modelling Framework
tools.detailed_description: Raven is a flexible hydrological modelling framework that allows for the discretization of watersheds and the simulation of hydrological processes using various algorithms.

tools.name: RavenPy
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for Raven hydrological model
tools.detailed_description: RavenPy is a Python wrapper that facilitates the setup, execution, and analysis of the Raven hydrological modelling framework, enabling easier integration into Python workflows.

tools.name: Subzero.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Discrete Element Sea Ice Model in Julia
tools.detailed_description: Subzero.jl is a native Julia implementation of a Discrete Element Method (DEM) sea ice model, designed for simulating sea ice dynamics and mechanics.

tools.name: CHM
tools.one_line_profile: Canadian Hydrological Model
tools.detailed_description: The Canadian Hydrological Model (CHM) is a multi-scale, multi-physics hydrological model designed for cold-region hydrological simulations, focusing on snow and mountain hydrology.

tools.name: SCOPE
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation model for radiative transfer, photosynthesis, and energy fluxes
tools.detailed_description: SCOPE (Soil Canopy Observation, Photochemistry and Energy fluxes) is a vertical integrated radiative transfer and energy balance model. It simulates the transfer of radiation, photosynthesis, and energy fluxes in vegetation and soil.

tools.name: pangu-weather-verify
tools.one_line_profile: Validation tool for Pangu Weather Forecasting Model
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to validate the Pangu Weather Forecasting Model against real-world meteorological observations, facilitating the assessment of AI-based weather model performance.

tools.name: ClimaCore.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamical core for CliMA Earth system models
tools.detailed_description: ClimaCore.jl provides the dynamical core components for the Climate Machine (CliMA) Earth system model, handling the discretization and solving of fluid dynamics equations on the sphere.

tools.name: ClimaDiagnostics.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Diagnostics framework for CliMA simulations
tools.detailed_description: A framework to define, compute, and output observables and statistics from CliMA simulations, enabling analysis of model outputs.

tools.name: ClimaSeaIce.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Sea ice simulation model for Earth system modeling
tools.detailed_description: Provides coupled and stand-alone simulations of sea ice thermodynamics and dynamics for Earth system modeling applications within the CliMA ecosystem.

tools.name: ClimateMachine.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Earth System Model that learns from data
tools.detailed_description: Climate Machine is a next-generation Earth System Model (ESM) designed to automatically learn from data, integrating physics-based modeling with data-driven approaches.

tools.name: Insolation.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Solar radiation and geometry calculator for climate modeling
tools.detailed_description: Calculates solar radiation and solar geometry, including zenith angle, azimuth angle, and insolation at the top of the atmosphere, specifically for climate science and Earth system modeling.

tools.name: RRTMGP.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Radiative Transfer Model for General Circulation Models
tools.detailed_description: A Julia implementation of the Rapid and accurate Radiative Transfer Model for GCMs (RRTMGP), used for computing radiative fluxes in atmospheric models.

tools.name: SurfaceFluxes.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Surface flux computation library for Earth system models
tools.detailed_description: A package for computing surface fluxes of heat, moisture, and momentum between the atmosphere, ocean, and land components of Earth system models.

tools.name: climt
tools.one_line_profile: Python-based climate modelling toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for building and running climate models using Python. It provides a modular framework for combining different physical components and dynamical cores.

tools.name: climate-ref
tools.one_line_profile: Rapid Evaluation Framework for CMIP simulations
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed for the rapid evaluation of CMIP (Coupled Model Intercomparison Project) simulations, facilitating the assessment of climate model performance.

tools.name: qgs
tools.one_line_profile: Quasi-geostrophic atmospheric model
tools.detailed_description: A 2-layer quasi-geostrophic atmospheric model implemented in Python, capable of coupling with simple land or shallow-water ocean components for studying atmospheric dynamics.

tools.name: MetaProteomeAnalyzer
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis and visualization software for metaproteomics data
tools.detailed_description: MetaProteomeAnalyzer (MPA) is a software tool for analyzing and visualizing mass spectrometry-based metaproteomics data, supporting protein identification and quantification.

tools.name: satellite-image-super-resolution
tools.one_line_profile: Super Resolution Imaging System for Satellite Imagery
tools.detailed_description: An end-to-end workflow and model system leveraging Deep Transfer Learning and Computer Vision to perform super-resolution on satellite imagery, specifically for assessing climate action interventions.

tools.name: CryoGrid3
tools.one_line_profile: Land surface model for permafrost environments
tools.detailed_description: A one-dimensional land surface model dedicated to simulating ground temperatures and thermal processes in permafrost environments.

tools.name: CryoGridCommunity
tools.one_line_profile: Community version of the CryoGrid permafrost model
tools.detailed_description: The community version of CryoGrid, a numerical model designed to investigate land surface processes and ground thermal regimes in permafrost environments.

tools.name: BG_Flood
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated shallow water hydrodynamics model
tools.detailed_description: A numerical model for simulating shallow water hydrodynamics on the GPU, designed for simulating inundation events such as river floods, storm surges, or tsunamis.

tools.name: pywatershed
tools.one_line_profile: Hydrologic model implementation in Python
tools.detailed_description: A hydrologic model implemented in Python, designed to simulate watershed processes and support hydrologic research and analysis.

tools.name: NWPeval
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation package for numerical weather prediction models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to facilitate the evaluation and analysis of numerical weather prediction (NWP) models against observations or other datasets.

tools.name: DeepSpark
tools.one_line_profile: Open platform for industrial application algorithms and models
tools.detailed_description: An open platform that provides a collection of open source application algorithms and models coupled with industrial applications, including a multi-dimensional evaluation system.

tools.name: Visual HEIFLOW
tools.one_line_profile: Graphical modeling environment for hydrological modeling
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive graphical modeling environment for integrated hydrological modeling, facilitating the setup and analysis of hydrological simulations.

tools.name: Wflow.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Hydrological modeling framework in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for hydrological modeling, providing a framework for running distributed hydrological models.

tools.name: E3SM
tools.one_line_profile: Energy Exascale Earth System Model
tools.detailed_description: The Energy Exascale Earth System Model (E3SM) is a state-of-the-art earth system modeling, simulation, and prediction project that optimizes the use of DOE's high-performance computing facilities.

tools.name: EKAT
tools.one_line_profile: HPC C++ libraries for E3SM ecosystem
tools.detailed_description: A collection of tools and libraries for writing Kokkos-enabled High Performance Computing (HPC) C++ code within the E3SM ecosystem, facilitating efficient model development.

tools.name: e3sm_diags
tools.one_line_profile: Diagnostics package for E3SM
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for evaluating and analyzing the performance of the Energy Exascale Earth System Model (E3SM) through various diagnostic metrics and plots.

tools.name: e3sm_to_cmip
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to convert E3SM output to CMIP format
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to transform E3SM model output data into the standardized CMIP (Coupled Model Intercomparison Project) format (CMORization).

tools.name: gdess
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation tool for atmospheric CO2 in Earth system models
tools.detailed_description: A tool for evaluating atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations as simulated by Earth system models against observational data.

tools.name: iESM
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated Earth System Model coupling GCAM and CESM
tools.detailed_description: The Integrated Earth System Model (iESM) couples the Global Change Assessment Model (GCAM) to the Community Earth System Model (CESM) to study interactions between human and earth systems.

tools.name: polaris
tools.one_line_profile: Testing and analysis framework for E3SM ocean and ice components
tools.detailed_description: A framework for testing and analysis of the OMEGA, MPAS-Ocean, MALI, and MPAS-Seaice components within the E3SM ecosystem.

tools.name: SCREAM
tools.one_line_profile: Exascale global atmosphere model in C++
tools.detailed_description: A global atmosphere model written in C++ (Simple Cloud-Resolving E3SM Atmosphere Model), designed for exascale computing performance.

tools.name: zppy
tools.one_line_profile: Post-processing toolchain for E3SM
tools.detailed_description: A post-processing toolchain for the Energy Exascale Earth System Model (E3SM), automating analysis and visualization tasks.

tools.name: GEM
tools.one_line_profile: Global Environmental Multiscale numerical weather prediction model
tools.detailed_description: The Global Environmental Multiscale (GEM) model is a numerical weather prediction model developed by Environment and Climate Change Canada for operational weather forecasting.

tools.name: librmn
tools.one_line_profile: Library of routines for numerical weather prediction
tools.detailed_description: A collection of core routines and utilities used for numerical weather prediction tasks within the Environment and Climate Change Canada modeling ecosystem.

tools.name: rtm_inv
tools.one_line_profile: Radiative transfer model inversion for crop trait retrieval
tools.detailed_description: A Python-backend tool for performing inversion of radiative transfer models to retrieve crop traits from remote sensing data.

tools.name: CDEPS
tools.one_line_profile: Community Data Models for Earth Prediction Systems
tools.detailed_description: A set of compliant data components (atmosphere, ocean, sea-ice, land, river, wave) designed for coupling within Earth Prediction Systems, facilitating the exchange of forcing data between coupled model components.

tools.name: CESM
tools.one_line_profile: Community Earth System Model
tools.detailed_description: A fully-coupled, global climate model that provides state-of-the-art computer simulations of the Earth's past, present, and future climate states, composed of separate models simultaneously simulating the earth's atmosphere, ocean, land, land-ice, and sea-ice.

tools.name: CTSM
tools.one_line_profile: Community Terrestrial Systems Model
tools.detailed_description: The Community Terrestrial Systems Model (CTSM) includes the Community Land Model (CLM) and serves as the land component for the Community Earth System Model (CESM), simulating land surface processes, hydrology, and biogeochemistry.

tools.name: MOM_interface
tools.one_line_profile: CESM interface to MOM Ocean Model
tools.detailed_description: The interface layer that allows the Modular Ocean Model (MOM) to be coupled and run within the Community Earth System Model (CESM) framework.

tools.name: MOSART
tools.one_line_profile: Model for Scale Adaptive River Transport
tools.detailed_description: A river transport model designed for large-scale applications, serving as the river component in the Community Earth System Model (CESM) to simulate river flow and discharge.

tools.name: POP2-CESM
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel Ocean Program (POP2) in CESM
tools.detailed_description: The Parallel Ocean Program version 2 (POP2) adapted for use as the ocean component within the Community Earth System Model (CESM).

tools.name: SimpleLand
tools.one_line_profile: Simple Land Model for CESM
tools.detailed_description: A simplified land model (SLIM) for the Community Earth System Model (CESM), designed for specific experimental configurations or reduced complexity simulations.

tools.name: visualCaseGen
tools.one_line_profile: GUI for configuring CESM cases
tools.detailed_description: A graphical user interface designed to assist researchers in configuring and setting up cases for the Community Earth System Model (CESM), simplifying the workflow for model execution.

tools.name: ESMValCore
tools.one_line_profile: Core engine for ESMValTool pre-processing
tools.detailed_description: The core library for ESMValTool that handles the pre-processing of data from Earth system models, including data finding, loading, fixing, and checking against CMIP standards.

tools.name: ESMValTool
tools.one_line_profile: Earth System Model Evaluation Tool
tools.detailed_description: A community diagnostics and performance metrics tool for the routine evaluation of Earth system models in CMIP, allowing for comparison against observations and other models.

tools.name: NoahMP
tools.one_line_profile: Noah land surface model with multiparameterization options
tools.detailed_description: A land surface model (LSM) that augments the Noah LSM with multiple parameterization options for key physical processes, used for simulating land-atmosphere interactions.

tools.name: FESOM2
tools.one_line_profile: Finite-volumE Sea ice-Ocean Model version 2
tools.detailed_description: A multi-resolution ocean general circulation model that uses unstructured meshes to simulate ocean dynamics and sea ice, allowing for variable resolution in different regions.

tools.name: HiRAM
tools.one_line_profile: GFDL High Resolution Atmospheric Model
tools.detailed_description: A global high-resolution atmospheric model developed by GFDL, capable of simulating the statistics of tropical storms and significant weather events with high fidelity.

tools.name: PROPTI

tools.detailed_description: An interface tool that couples simulation models (e.g., fire dynamics) with optimization algorithms to solve the inverse problem of material parameter estimation.

tools.name: SPHY
tools.one_line_profile: Spatial Processes in HYdrology model
tools.detailed_description: A spatially distributed hydrological model that integrates key hydrologic processes including glacier melt, snow melt, groundwater, and routing, suitable for basin-scale studies.

tools.name: AeroApps
tools.one_line_profile: Aerosol applications for GEOS-ESM
tools.detailed_description: A collection of aerosol applications supporting mission development, model analysis, and atmospheric radiative transfer within the GEOS Earth System Model framework.

tools.name: GEOSgcm
tools.one_line_profile: GEOS Earth System Model
tools.detailed_description: The Goddard Earth Observing System (GEOS) General Circulation Model (GCM), a comprehensive Earth system model used for weather analysis, prediction, and climate research.

tools.name: GEOSgcm_GridComp

tools.detailed_description: Contains the physics and Incremental Analysis Update (IAU) code components for the GEOS Earth System Model.

tools.name: MAPL

tools.detailed_description: A foundation layer of the GEOS architecture that supplements the Earth System Modeling Framework (ESMF) to facilitate the development and coupling of model components.

tools.name: gis4wrf

tools.detailed_description: A QGIS plugin that provides tools for pre-processing, post-processing, visualizing, and running simulations with the Weather Research and Forecasting (WRF) model.

tools.name: pyLBL
tools.one_line_profile: Python line-by-line radiative transfer model
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of a line-by-line radiative transfer model for calculating atmospheric transmission and radiance.

tools.name: GRAL GUI

tools.detailed_description: A Graphical User Interface for the atmospheric dispersion model GRAL and the mesoscale wind field model GRAMM, facilitating model configuration and execution.

tools.name: HiPIMS-FLAMEGPU

tools.detailed_description: A coupled model framework integrating high-performance hydrodynamic modeling (HiPIMS) with agent-based modeling (FLAMEGPU) to simulate interactions between human activities and flooding.

tools.name: SLABIM

tools.name: FastGaussianPuff

tools.name: EEMD-Project

tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of the Ensemble Empirical Mode Decomposition (EEMD) algorithm, used for analyzing non-linear and non-stationary time series data.

tools.name: topmodel

tools.detailed_description: An R package implementing the TOPMODEL hydrological model, which is a rainfall-runoff model based on the idea that the topography of the catchment determines its hydrological response.

tools.name: ISSM

tools.detailed_description: An Abaqus user material (UMAT) framework for multi-field problems, implementing a thermo-mechanically coupled gradient-enhanced damage model.

tools.detailed_description: A Python library to download and process GOES-16 and GOES-17 satellite data from NOAA's AWS archive, providing easy access to NetCDF files.

tools.name: BlenderNC
tools.one_line_profile: Blender addon to visualize scientific gridded data
tools.detailed_description: An extension for Blender that enables the import and high-quality 3D visualization of scientific data formats like NetCDF and GRIB, bridging science and computer graphics.

tools.name: sarsen
tools.one_line_profile: Algorithms for Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) processing
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing algorithms and utilities for processing and geometric correction of Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) data, integrating with the xarray ecosystem.

tools.name: xarray-sentinel
tools.one_line_profile: Xarray backend for Sentinel-1 satellite data
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that provides an xarray backend for reading Copernicus Sentinel-1 satellite data products directly into labeled arrays for analysis.

tools.name: nnja-ai
tools.one_line_profile: Data loader for the NNJA Earth System Reanalysis archive
tools.detailed_description: Tools to access and load data from the Brightband AI-ready mirror of the NOAA NASA Joint Archive (NNJA), facilitating AI research on Earth system reanalysis data.

tools.name: h5cube
tools.one_line_profile: Gaussian CUBE file compression via HDF5
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for compressing Gaussian CUBE files (used in computational chemistry) into HDF5 binary storage, optimizing storage and I/O efficiency.

tools.name: ncov-cfr
tools.one_line_profile: R code for estimating COVID-19 case fatality ratio
tools.detailed_description: R scripts and methodology for estimating the case fatality ratio (CFR) of COVID-19 using data from cases outside China during the early pandemic.

tools.name: grib2json
tools.one_line_profile: Converter from GRIB2 to JSON format
tools.detailed_description: A Java utility that converts GRIB2 meteorological data files into JSON format, enabling the use of weather data in web applications and visualizations.

tools.name: ndpyramid
tools.one_line_profile: Utility for generating ND array pyramids from Xarray/Zarr data
tools.detailed_description: A small utility designed to generate multi-scale pyramids for N-dimensional arrays using Xarray and Zarr, facilitating efficient visualization of large scientific datasets.

tools.name: zarr-gl
tools.one_line_profile: WebGL Zarr layer for Mapbox and Maplibre
tools.detailed_description: A custom WebGL layer enabling the rendering of Zarr-based geospatial data directly within Mapbox GL JS and MapLibre GL maps, supporting scientific data visualization on the web.

tools.name: HDF5Zarr
tools.one_line_profile: Library for reading HDF5 files using Zarr
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that enables reading HDF5 files through the Zarr interface, facilitating interoperability between these two major scientific data formats.

tools.name: F90GIO
tools.one_line_profile: General I/O interface for NetCDF/HDF in Fortran90
tools.detailed_description: A general Input/Output interface library for Fortran90, providing simplified access to NetCDF, HDF4, and HDF5 formats, commonly used in climate modeling and HPC.

tools.name: reki
tools.one_line_profile: Meteorological data preparation tool for CMA systems
tools.detailed_description: A data preparation and handling tool developed for the China Meteorological Administration (CMA/CEMC), supporting the processing of meteorological data formats like GRIB2.

tools.name: icclim
tools.one_line_profile: Climate indices and indicators calculation library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library based on Xarray for calculating climate indices and indicators, adhering to international standards (ECA&D, ETCCDI).

tools.name: imagecodecs
tools.one_line_profile: Image transformation and compression codecs for scientific data
tools.detailed_description: A library providing a wide range of image transformation, compression, and decompression codecs (e.g., ZFP, JPEG XR, LZW) used heavily in scientific imaging and bio-imaging.

tools.name: tifffile
tools.one_line_profile: Reader and writer for scientific TIFF files
tools.detailed_description: A powerful Python library for reading and writing TIFF files, with support for multidimensional arrays and metadata used in microscopy and biomedical research.

tools.name: netcdfjs
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript library to read and explore NetCDF files
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library that allows reading and parsing NetCDF files in the browser or Node.js environment, enabling web-based scientific data exploration.

tools.name: z5
tools.one_line_profile: C++ and Python interface for Zarr and N5 formats
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight C++ library with Python bindings for reading and writing multi-dimensional datasets in Zarr and N5 formats, commonly used in connectomics and large-scale imaging.

tools.name: geocube
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to convert vector data to rasterized xarray data
tools.detailed_description: A tool that simplifies the conversion of geospatial vector data (GeoDataFrame) into rasterized Xarray objects, facilitating integration of vector and raster data in scientific workflows.

tools.name: rioxarray
tools.one_line_profile: Geospatial Xarray extension powered by Rasterio
tools.detailed_description: An extension for Xarray that provides geospatial capabilities (like reprojection and clipping) by leveraging Rasterio, widely used for processing NetCDF and GeoTIFF data.

tools.name: cubed
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable array processing with bounded memory
tools.detailed_description: A library for scalable array processing that operates with bounded memory constraints, serving as an alternative backend for Xarray in scientific computing workflows.

tools.name: daio
tools.one_line_profile: Video and data IO tools for Python
tools.detailed_description: A collection of IO tools for handling video and data formats, specifically designed for neurophysiology experiments (e.g., Danionella fish research).

tools.name: NetCDF4-variable-streamer
tools.one_line_profile: Streamer for chunked reading/writing of NetCDF4 variables
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that extends the netCDF4 package to support streaming and chunked reading/writing of variables, optimizing memory usage for large datasets.

tools.name: versioned-hdf5
tools.one_line_profile: Versioned abstraction on top of HDF5
tools.detailed_description: A library that implements a versioning system on top of HDF5 files, allowing for git-like tracking of data changes within scientific datasets.

tools.name: titiler-multidim
tools.one_line_profile: TiTiler application for NetCDF/Zarr datasets
tools.detailed_description: A specialized application based on TiTiler for serving and visualizing multi-dimensional scientific datasets (NetCDF, Zarr) as dynamic map tiles.

tools.name: prosEO
tools.one_line_profile: Processing system for Earth Observation data
tools.detailed_description: A processing system developed by DLR (German Aerospace Center) for handling and processing Earth Observation (EO) data.

tools.name: fuse-netcdf
tools.one_line_profile: FUSE file system for mounting NetCDF files
tools.detailed_description: A Python utility developed as part of an ECMWF Summer of Weather Code (ESoWC) project to mount NetCDF files as a file system in user space, allowing standard file operations on NetCDF contents.

tools.name: icechunk
tools.one_line_profile: Cloud-native transactional tensor storage engine
tools.detailed_description: An open-source, cloud-native transactional tensor storage engine designed for managing large-scale multidimensional arrays, often used in geospatial and scientific computing contexts.

tools.name: lisflood-utilities
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for the LISFLOOD hydrological model
tools.detailed_description: A collection of utilities for the LISFLOOD hydrological rainfall-runoff model, developed by the European Commission Joint Research Centre (JRC), assisting in data preparation and model execution.

tools.name: climetlab-s2s-ai-challenge
tools.one_line_profile: Climetlab plugin for S2S AI Challenge data access
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for Climetlab that provides access to subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) forecast datasets specifically for the S2S AI Challenge.

tools.name: cfgrib
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface to map GRIB files to NetCDF Common Data Model
tools.detailed_description: A Python interface that maps GRIB files to the NetCDF Common Data Model following the CF Convention, utilizing ecCodes for decoding. It allows GRIB files to be accessed as if they were NetCDF files.

tools.name: climetlab
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for easy access to weather and climate data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package developed by ECMWF to simplify access to weather and climate datasets, providing a unified interface for loading and handling meteorological data.

tools.name: eccodes
tools.one_line_profile: GRIB and BUFR decoding/encoding library
tools.detailed_description: ECMWF's primary library for decoding and encoding meteorological data in GRIB and BUFR formats. It provides the core C/C++ API for handling these standard WMO formats.

tools.name: eccodes-python
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface to ecCodes
tools.detailed_description: The Python interface to the ecCodes GRIB and BUFR decoding/encoding library, allowing Python users to interact with meteorological data formats using the ecCodes C API.

tools.name: Magics
tools.one_line_profile: Meteorological data plotting package
tools.detailed_description: A plotting package developed by ECMWF to visualise meteorological data in GRIB, NetCDF, BUFR, and ODB formats, supporting the generation of publication-quality weather maps.

tools.name: pdbufr
tools.one_line_profile: High-level BUFR interface for ecCodes
tools.detailed_description: A high-level Python interface for reading BUFR files using ecCodes, designed to provide a more pandas-friendly way to handle BUFR data.

tools.name: pyeccodes
tools.one_line_profile: Pure Python GRIB decoder
tools.detailed_description: An experimental pure Python implementation of a GRIB decoder, aiming to provide GRIB reading capabilities without binary dependencies on the C ecCodes library.

tools.name: SkinnyWMS
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight WMS server for NetCDF and GRIB data
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Web Map Service (WMS) server designed to serve maps generated directly from NetCDF and GRIB data files, facilitating the visualization of meteorological data over the web.

tools.name: eodms-cli
tools.one_line_profile: CLI for Earth Observation Data Management System
tools.detailed_description: A command-line interface script used to search, order, and download imagery from the Earth Observation Data Management System (EODMS) provided by Natural Resources Canada.

tools.name: py-eodms-rapi
tools.one_line_profile: Python client for EODMS REST API
tools.detailed_description: A Python package used to access the REST API service provided by the Earth Observation Data Management System (EODMS) from Natural Resources Canada.

tools.name: OneFLOW
tools.one_line_profile: Large-scale multiphysics CFD simulation environment
tools.detailed_description: A large-scale multiphysics scientific simulation environment focusing on Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD).

tools.name: h5cpp
tools.one_line_profile: C++ wrapper for HDF5 C-library
tools.detailed_description: A C++ wrapper for the HDF5 C-library, providing a more convenient C++ interface for handling HDF5 files, widely used in scientific data storage.

tools.name: SGS
tools.one_line_profile: Browser for visualizing single-cell and spatial multiomics data
tools.detailed_description: A user-friendly, collaborative browser for visualizing single-cell and spatial multiomics data, facilitating the exploration of complex biological datasets.

tools.name: ngff-zarr
tools.one_line_profile: OME NGFF Zarr implementation
tools.detailed_description: A lean implementation of the Open Microscopy Environment (OME) Next Generation File Format (NGFF) using Zarr, facilitating the handling of microscopy data.

tools.name: Tidy3D
tools.one_line_profile: Fast electromagnetic FDTD solver
tools.detailed_description: A fast, scalable electromagnetic solver based on the Finite-Difference Time-Domain (FDTD) method, used for simulating electromagnetic wave interactions.

tools.name: salem
tools.one_line_profile: Geolocalised subsetting, masking, and plotting for xarray
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that adds geolocalised subsetting, masking, and plotting operations to xarray, specifically designed for handling geospatial and climate data.

tools.name: h5pyViewer
tools.one_line_profile: Viewer for HDF5 files
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based viewer for HDF5 files, allowing users to inspect the structure and contents of HDF5 datasets commonly used in science.

tools.name: hidefix

tools.detailed_description: A Rust library for concurrent reading of HDF5 and NetCDF4 files, optimizing data access performance for scientific applications.

tools.name: netcdf
tools.one_line_profile: High-level netCDF bindings for Rust
tools.detailed_description: High-level Rust bindings for the NetCDF library, enabling Rust applications to read and write NetCDF files used in climate and earth sciences.

tools.name: georinex
tools.one_line_profile: RINEX reader and converter to HDF5
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for reading RINEX 2/3 NAV/OBS/sp3 files and batch converting them to HDF5 format with C-like speed, used in GNSS and geospace research.

tools.name: h5fortran
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight HDF5 polymorphic Fortran interface
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, polymorphic Fortran interface for HDF5, simplifying the reading and writing of HDF5 files in Fortran scientific codes.

tools.name: matlab-stdlib
tools.one_line_profile: Unofficial standard library for MATLAB including HDF5 and NetCDF4 interfaces
tools.detailed_description: A collection of MATLAB functions providing interfaces for HDF5 and NetCDF4 file I/O, along with other system utilities, acting as an extended standard library for scientific computing in MATLAB.

tools.name: nc4fortran
tools.one_line_profile: Object-oriented Fortran interface for NetCDF4
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, object-oriented Fortran wrapper for the NetCDF4 C library, simplifying the reading and writing of NetCDF files in modern Fortran scientific applications.

tools.name: PyRINEX
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for reading and writing GNSS RINEX files
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for parsing and processing RINEX (Receiver Independent Exchange Format) files, which are the standard format for GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite System) data, supporting observation and navigation data.

tools.name: DINCAE
tools.one_line_profile: Neural network for reconstructing missing satellite observation data
tools.detailed_description: DINCAE (Data-Interpolating Convolutional Auto-Encoder) is a deep learning model designed to fill gaps (reconstruct missing data) in satellite observations, particularly for oceanographic data like sea surface temperature.

tools.name: dmrpp-generator
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to generate DMR++ files from NetCDF4 and HDF5
tools.detailed_description: A utility to generate DMR++ (Data Access Protocol Metadata Response) files, which are used to optimize serving of NetCDF4 and HDF5 data via OPeNDAP/Hyrax servers in earth science data systems.

tools.name: stackstac
tools.one_line_profile: Convert STAC catalogs into dask-based xarray objects
tools.detailed_description: A library that bridges SpatioTemporal Asset Catalogs (STAC) and Xarray, allowing users to load geospatial data from STAC items directly into Xarray DataArrays with Dask backing for lazy loading and parallel processing.

tools.name: GDL
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source interpreter for IDL (Interactive Data Language)
tools.detailed_description: GNU Data Language (GDL) is a free, open-source alternative to IDL (Interactive Data Language), widely used in astronomy, geosciences, and medical imaging for data analysis and visualization.

tools.name: gonum/hdf5
tools.one_line_profile: Go interface for the HDF5 library
tools.detailed_description: A wrapper package providing an interface to the HDF5 C library for the Go programming language, enabling Go applications to read and write HDF5 scientific data files.

tools.name: torch-hdf5
tools.one_line_profile: Torch (Lua) interface to HDF5 library
tools.detailed_description: A library providing HDF5 file format support for the Lua Torch deep learning framework, allowing reading and writing of large scientific datasets directly into Torch tensors.

tools.name: arco-era5
tools.one_line_profile: Pipelines for creating Analysis-Ready Cloud Optimized ERA5 datasets
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Apache Beam pipelines and scripts to process ECMWF ERA5 climate reanalysis data into Analysis-Ready & Cloud Optimized (ARCO) formats (like Zarr), facilitating large-scale cloud-based climate research.

tools.name: Xee
tools.one_line_profile: Xarray extension for Google Earth Engine
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that integrates Google Earth Engine's data catalog and processing capabilities with Xarray, allowing users to work with GEE data using Xarray's data model and API.

tools.name: xarray-beam
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed Xarray processing with Apache Beam
tools.detailed_description: A library that adapts Xarray data structures for distributed processing using Apache Beam, enabling scalable analysis of massive multidimensional scientific datasets.

tools.name: gribscan
tools.one_line_profile: Index generator and Xarray interface for GRIB files
tools.detailed_description: A tool to scan GRIB files (common in meteorology) to create indices, enabling fast, cloud-friendly access to GRIB data via Xarray without reading the entire file.

tools.name: zarr.js
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript implementation of the Zarr storage format
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for reading and writing Zarr data, enabling web-based visualization and processing of chunked, compressed, N-dimensional arrays used in science.

tools.name: h5netcdf
tools.one_line_profile: Pythonic interface to NetCDF4 via h5py
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that reads and writes NetCDF4 files directly using h5py (HDF5 interface), avoiding the need for the official netCDF C library dependency while maintaining API compatibility.

tools.name: h5py
tools.one_line_profile: Pythonic interface to the HDF5 binary data format
tools.detailed_description: The fundamental Python package for interacting with HDF5 binary data format, widely used in scientific computing for storing large numerical datasets.

tools.name: climata
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for loading climate and flow time series data
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to load and iterate over climate and hydrology time series data from various web services (ACIS, SNOTEL, NWIS, etc.), facilitating data acquisition for environmental research.

tools.name: viv
tools.one_line_profile: Library for multiscale visualization of high-resolution bioimaging data
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for rendering high-resolution, multiplexed bioimaging data (Zarr, OME-TIFF) directly in the browser, supporting scientific visualization needs.

tools.name: vizarr
tools.one_line_profile: Minimal Zarr image viewer based on Viv
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight web-based viewer tool for Zarr images, built on top of the Viv library, allowing quick inspection of scientific image data stored in Zarr format.

tools.name: hvplot
tools.one_line_profile: High-level plotting API for pandas, dask, and xarray
tools.detailed_description: A high-level visualization library that provides a convenient plotting API for PyData ecosystem tools (pandas, xarray, dask), widely used for interactive scientific data exploration and visualization.

tools.name: mvstats
tools.one_line_profile: Vectorized multivariate statistical functions for earth system data
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing vectorized implementations of multivariate statistical functions specifically designed for analyzing multi-dimensional earth system science data.

tools.name: iris_lama

tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for Simultaneous Localization and Mapping (SLAM), providing algorithms for robot navigation and environment mapping, which is a core task in robotics research.

tools.name: iris_lama_ros
tools.one_line_profile: ROS wrapper for the LaMa localization and mapping library
tools.detailed_description: The Robot Operating System (ROS) interface for the iris_lama library, enabling the use of LaMa SLAM algorithms within the ROS ecosystem for robotics research.

tools.name: jhdf

tools.detailed_description: A pure Java implementation of the HDF5 file format, allowing access to HDF5 data without native dependencies. It supports reading datasets, groups, and attributes, making it suitable for Java-based scientific applications needing HDF5 I/O.

tools.name: xmovie
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for creating movies from xarray objects
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to create high-quality animations and movies directly from xarray data structures. It simplifies the visualization of time-varying multidimensional scientific data, such as climate model outputs.

tools.name: pybufr-ecmwf

tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper around the ECMWF BUFR library, enabling the reading and writing of BUFR (Binary Universal Form for the Representation of meteorological data) files. It allows Python-based workflows to interact with this standard meteorological binary format.

tools.name: GeoWombat
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for geospatial data processing and analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python library built on top of Xarray and Rasterio for efficient geospatial data processing. It provides a simplified API for tasks like radiometric adjustment, temporal statistics, and machine learning classification on satellite imagery.

tools.name: ncdump-json

tools.detailed_description: A modified version of the standard ncdump utility that outputs NetCDF file contents (header info and data) in JSON format. This facilitates the integration of NetCDF data into web applications and other JSON-based workflows.

tools.name: pygrib
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface for reading and writing GRIB data
tools.detailed_description: A Python extension module that interfaces with the ECMWF ecCodes library to read and write GRIB (GRidded Binary) files. It is widely used in meteorology for handling weather forecast data.

tools.name: jupyterlab-hdf5
tools.one_line_profile: JupyterLab extension for exploring HDF5 files
tools.detailed_description: A JupyterLab extension that allows users to open, browse, and explore HDF5 files directly within the JupyterLab interface. It supports large datasets and provides a convenient way to inspect hierarchical data structures without writing code.

tools.name: era5_in_gee
tools.one_line_profile: Tools to ingest ERA5 data into Google Earth Engine
tools.detailed_description: A set of Python scripts and functions designed to facilitate the uploading and ingestion of ECMWF ERA5 climate reanalysis data into Google Earth Engine (GEE) for cloud-based geospatial analysis.

tools.name: pizzarr
tools.one_line_profile: Zarr array access for R
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides access to Zarr arrays, enabling R users to read and slice data stored in the Zarr format. This is essential for interoperability in cloud-native scientific data workflows.

tools.name: 3d-data-precrocessing
tools.one_line_profile: 3D medical image preprocessing toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit for preprocessing 3D medical images, supporting conversion between NIfTI and HDF5 formats, DICOM to NIfTI conversion, 3D patch cropping, and ROI extraction. Useful for preparing medical data for deep learning models.

tools.name: xarray-spatial
tools.one_line_profile: Raster-based spatial analytics for Python
tools.detailed_description: A library that implements common raster analysis functions (e.g., zonal statistics, proximity, surface analysis) using Numba and Xarray. It is designed to be free of GDAL/GEOS dependencies and works well with Dask for parallel processing.

tools.name: D-Tale
tools.one_line_profile: Visualizer for Pandas data structures
tools.detailed_description: A visualizer for Pandas dataframes that provides a GUI for viewing, analyzing, and editing data. While general-purpose, it is widely used in scientific data workflows for exploratory data analysis (EDA) of tabular data.

tools.name: simple-zarr-server
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight HTTP server for Zarr datasets
tools.detailed_description: A simple Python-based server designed to serve Zarr datasets over HTTP. It facilitates the sharing and remote access of Zarr-formatted scientific data.

tools.name: zarrita.js
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript toolkit for Zarr chunked array I/O
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight JavaScript library for reading and writing Zarr-based chunked, compressed, n-dimensional arrays, enabling web-based scientific data visualization and analysis.

tools.name: grib-doctor
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for debugging and fixing GRIB weather data files
tools.detailed_description: A set of command-line utilities designed to handle and correct quirks and irregularities in GRIB format weather data files, facilitating data ingestion pipelines.

tools.name: ncvue
tools.one_line_profile: Minimal GUI for quick visualization of NetCDF files
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based graphical user interface designed as a drop-in replacement for 'ncview', providing quick and easy visualization of NetCDF data files.

tools.name: NetCDF.jl
tools.one_line_profile: NetCDF support library for the Julia programming language
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing a high-level and low-level interface to the NetCDF library, enabling reading, writing, and manipulation of NetCDF data in Julia.

tools.name: ezh5
tools.one_line_profile: Easy-to-use C++ template interface for HDF5
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library that simplifies interactions with the HDF5 library using templates, making it easier to read and write scientific data in HDF5 format.

tools.name: h5pySWMR

tools.detailed_description: A Python library (discontinued but functional) serving as a drop-in replacement for h5py to enable Single Write Multiple Read (SWMR) access patterns for HDF5 files.

tools.name: HydroData
tools.one_line_profile: R package for retrieving geospatial earth systems data
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed to facilitate the discovery and retrieval of geospatial earth systems and hydrology data from various sources.

tools.name: LaGriT
tools.one_line_profile: Los Alamos Grid Toolbox for mesh generation and optimization
tools.detailed_description: A library of user-callable tools for mesh generation, optimization, and dynamic maintenance in 2D and 3D, widely used in geology, geophysics, and finite element modeling.

tools.name: majicweather
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization generator for GFS and WaveWatchIII GRIB files
tools.detailed_description: A C++ tool designed to generate visualizations from GFS (Global Forecast System) and WaveWatchIII weather data in GRIB format.

tools.name: pv_atmos
tools.one_line_profile: ParaView scripting for atmospheric NetCDF data visualization
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python scripts to facilitate the scientific visualization of atmospheric NetCDF data using the ParaView software suite.

tools.name: h5py_cache
tools.one_line_profile: Cached HDF5 file access for Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library (deprecated) that creates h5py File objects with specified cache settings to optimize I/O performance for HDF5 files.

tools.name: netCDF-DataReader
tools.one_line_profile: Modelica library for interfacing with NetCDF files
tools.detailed_description: A Modelica library that provides functionality to read data from NetCDF files, supporting various interpolation and extrapolation methods for physical modeling.

tools.name: seurat-disk

tools.detailed_description: An R package providing interfaces for HDF5-based single-cell file formats, specifically designed to work with the Seurat ecosystem for single-cell genomics.

tools.name: merra2wps

tools.detailed_description: A Fortran tool for converting MERRA2 reanalysis data (NetCDF4) into the intermediate format required by the WRF Preprocessing System (WPS).

tools.name: gribberish

tools.detailed_description: A high-performance Rust library for parsing and reading GRIB (GRid in Binary) weather data files.

tools.name: grippy

tools.detailed_description: A pure Python library for parsing GRIB2 meteorological data files without external binary dependencies.

tools.name: lexcube
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive 3D Data Cube Visualization in Jupyter
tools.detailed_description: A Jupyter Notebook extension for interactive 3D visualization of large Earth system data cubes, enabling exploration of spatiotemporal data.

tools.name: harmony-netcdf-to-zarr

tools.detailed_description: A backend service component for NASA Harmony that performs transformation of NetCDF4 files into Zarr format to support cloud-native data access.

tools.name: harmony-py

tools.detailed_description: A Python client library for interacting with NASA's Harmony service, facilitating access, transformation, and retrieval of Earth observing system data.

tools.name: stitchee

tools.detailed_description: A NASA Harmony service designed to concatenate multiple NetCDF4 data files along an existing dimension, useful for aggregating time-series or spatial data.

tools.name: zarr-eosdis-store

tools.name: mesh_tools

tools.detailed_description: A collection of tools and message definitions for handling annotated 3D triangle meshes within the Robot Operating System (ROS), supporting scientific robotics and perception tasks.

tools.name: gribr

tools.name: generative-evaluation-prdc
tools.one_line_profile: Metrics for generative models (Precision, Recall, Density, Coverage)
tools.detailed_description: A library providing implementations of precision, recall, density, and coverage metrics for evaluating the quality and diversity of generative models.

tools.name: hn2016_falwa
tools.one_line_profile: Finite-Amplitude Local Wave Activity Diagnostics
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for computing Finite-Amplitude Local Wave Activity (FALWA) diagnostics from climate data, used for studying atmospheric dynamics.

tools.name: ML Interactive Visualization
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive visualization of ML model evaluation metrics
tools.detailed_description: A tool for the interactive visualization of machine learning model evaluation metrics, facilitating model analysis and comparison.

tools.name: DNNV
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for Deep Neural Network Verification
tools.detailed_description: A framework for the formal verification of deep neural networks, allowing researchers to verify properties of neural networks used in scientific applications.

tools.name: Open LLM Leaderboard Report
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization report of Open LLM model performance
tools.detailed_description: A tool to generate visualization reports of Open LLM model performance based on various metrics, aiding in the benchmarking and analysis of large language models.

tools.name: text-to-image-eval
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation metrics for text-to-image and zero-shot classification models
tools.detailed_description: A library to evaluate custom and HuggingFace text-to-image and zero-shot image classification models using metrics like Zero-shot accuracy, Linear Probe, and Image retrieval.

tools.name: torch-metrics
tools.one_line_profile: Metrics for model evaluation in PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A collection of metrics for evaluating machine learning models implemented in PyTorch, facilitating standardized performance measurement.

tools.name: EvalGIM
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation library for generative image models
tools.detailed_description: EvalGIM enables easy-to-use, reproducible automatic evaluations of text-to-image models and supports customization with user-defined metrics, datasets, and visualizations.

tools.name: Freva
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for Exascale Validation of climate models
tools.detailed_description: The Free Evaluation System Framework (FreVa) is a software infrastructure for standardized evaluation of climate models, facilitating data analysis and result sharing.

tools.name: long-form-factuality
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for long-form factuality in large language models
tools.detailed_description: A tool and benchmark for evaluating the long-form factuality of large language models, providing metrics to assess the accuracy of generated content.

tools.name: WeatherBench 2
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for next-generation data-driven global weather models
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark dataset and evaluation framework for assessing the performance of data-driven global weather forecasting models.

tools.name: WeatherBenchX
tools.one_line_profile: Modular framework for evaluating weather forecasts
tools.detailed_description: A modular framework designed for the evaluation of weather forecasts, supporting various metrics and data sources for comprehensive model assessment.

tools.name: metriks
tools.one_line_profile: Metrics for evaluating information retrieval models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing commonly used metrics for evaluating the performance of information retrieval models.

tools.name: ATS
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral modeling system for sound analysis and synthesis
tools.detailed_description: ATS is a spectral modeling system based on a sinusoidal plus critical-band noise decomposition, using psychoacoustic processing for perceptually accurate sound analysis and synthesis.

tools.name: Hera
tools.one_line_profile: Keras model training evaluation and dashboard streaming
tools.detailed_description: A tool to train and evaluate Keras models, streaming metrics to a dashboard in the browser for real-time monitoring and analysis.

tools.name: dgm-eval
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation metrics for deep generative models
tools.detailed_description: Codebase for evaluating deep generative models, focusing on exposing flaws in existing metrics and providing fairer treatment for diffusion models.

tools.name: Deception Benchmark
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for evaluating LLMs on disinformation creation and resistance
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark tool for evaluating Large Language Models (LLMs) on their ability to create and resist disinformation, including standardized evaluation metrics.

tools.name: t2v_metrics
tools.one_line_profile: VQAScore for evaluating text-to-image/video/3D models
tools.detailed_description: A library for evaluating text-to-image, text-to-video, and text-to-3D models using VQAScore, a metric based on Visual Question Answering.

tools.name: torcheval
tools.one_line_profile: Performant model metrics and evaluation tools for PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A library containing a rich collection of performant PyTorch model metrics, a simple interface to create new metrics, and tools for distributed training evaluation.

tools.name: ai-agent-evals
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation of AI agent applications using model-as-judge
tools.detailed_description: A tool to evaluate AI agent applications using model-as-a-judge, content safety, and mathematical metrics.

tools.name: Table Transformer
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning model for extracting tables from unstructured documents
tools.detailed_description: Table Transformer (TATR) is a deep learning model for extracting tables from unstructured documents (PDFs and images), including the GriTS evaluation metric.

tools.name: WeatherBench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark dataset and baseline models for data-driven weather forecasting
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark dataset for evaluating data-driven weather forecasting models, providing regridded ERA5 data and baseline evaluation metrics to facilitate model comparison.

tools.name: CliMT
tools.one_line_profile: Climate modelling and diagnostics toolkit (Legacy)
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for climate modeling and diagnostics, providing a Python interface to various climate codes and radiation models. (Note: This is the legacy version).

tools.name: xskillscore
tools.one_line_profile: Metrics for verifying weather and climate forecasts using xarray
tools.detailed_description: xskillscore is a Python package for verifying forecasts and hindcasts against observations. It provides a comprehensive suite of deterministic and probabilistic metrics (e.g., RMSE, Pearson correlation, CRPS) specifically designed to work with xarray DataArrays and Datasets, enabling efficient, parallelized verification of high-dimensional weather and climate model outputs.
